news_header: The change in the Alcohol Act has not affected grocery store sales, with a 1.9% increase in alcoholic beverage sales since the reform.
news_text: According to the Daily Goods Trading Strategy, the changes in the Alcohol Act have not impacted grocery store sales. In June, 8% of fermented beverages, including wines and strong beers, were sold. Sales statistics show a 1.9% increase in the value of alcoholic beverage sales since the reform. During July to September, beer sales accounted for 68%, while alcohol-free beer made up 4%.
